definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: She rode up bold as you please, m'lord, demanding words with you.
sentences.chinese: 她胆大包天的径直骑了过来，大人，要求和你说话。

sentences.english: IS THERE any limit to the audacity of Scandinavians?
sentences.chinese: 这些胆大包天的斯堪的纳维亚人就不知道个“度”吗？

sentences.english: Now that they were backed up, these fellows became audacious in the extreme.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有人撑腰，这帮家伙就变得胆大包天。

sentences.english: The man must be as bold as brass to have stolen money at mid-day.
sentences.chinese: 这男子胆大包天，居然在中午光天化日下偷钱。

sentences.english: There never was a hero who did not have his bounds.
sentences.chinese: 从来就没有胆大包天的英雄好汉。

sentences.english: The bandits pulled off a daring bank robbery.
sentences.chinese: 这伙强盗胆大包天，竟把银行抢了。

definition: regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
